speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Chuck Ranberg & Anne Flett-Giordano  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    _ACT ONE  Scene One -- KACL Frasier is doing his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: You're on KACL with Dr. Frasier Crane.  We have time for one more call. [_pushes button_] Hello, Gretchen.  I'm listening.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Gretchen
text: [_v.o.; German accent_] Well, you see, Dr. Crane, my husband is a fencing instructor, and lately he spends all his time with his wealthy new student.  He's with her day and night, and I'm afraid there's some... _bumsen_ going on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, is this just a suspicion or do you have any evidence?

speaker: Gretchen
text: No, it's just a feeling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, unfortunately, in these matters there's no simple way to know for sure.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, there is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Gretchen, you're in luck.  It just so happens that we have in our studio today one of the world's five leading

speaker: Roz
text: If you want to know if a man is cheating, you offer him two choices for dinner: one that's rich and fattening, and one that's light and sensible.  If he picks the one that's calorie-packed, he doesn't mind turning into a bloated pig, which means he's happily married and you're in the clear.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, when I hear advice like that, it makes me wish there was a law against two or more women gathering at a water cooler.  Now, Gretchen--

speaker: Gretchen
text: Does it really work, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, trust me.  If he chooses the diet plate, it means he's staying in shape for his main squeeze, and you should get yourself a lawyer who can sue the sweat off a racehorse.

speaker: Gretchen
text: I'm going to do it.  Thank you for your help, Roz!  Oh, and you, too, Dr. Crane. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't mention it.  Well, "Dr. Crane and Friends" will be back tomorrow.  Thanks for listening, Seattle.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, you hate it when I butt into your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: And yet...

speaker: Roz
text: You're gonna forgive me when you find out the wonderful thing I'm doing for you.  See, there's this great woman who lives in my building.  She's beautiful, and funny--

speaker: Frasier
text: Just stop right there, Roz.  I do not go out on blind dates. They're demeaning and a hideous waste of time.  No, thank you, no.

speaker: Roz
text: It's not for you, it's for your father.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  What time should he pick her up?

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a minute.  Blind dates are O.K. for your father, but not for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  That also goes for games with balls, domestic beer, and giant trucks that roll over smaller ones.  _Frasier leaves.  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment Martin and Niles are sitting at the dinner table with a large wooden model ship kit.  Martin keeps trying to pick up pieces, but Niles bats his hand away as he reads the instructions._

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading_] "So you want to build a three-masted schooner. Step One: before assembly, take inventory of all parts."

speaker: Martin
text: We don't need to read all these instructions.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, we do.  It says right here in boldface, "Read all instructions."

speaker: Martin
text: Just pass me the right side of the hull, will ya?

speaker: Niles
text: You'll get your hands on that piece at step sixteen and not a moment sooner.

speaker: Martin
text: Can we get started here?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right, Dad. [_reading_] "So you want to build a three- masted schooner."

speaker: Niles
text: [_grabs it away_] Give me that!  You'll put your eye out.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look at that!  What a beautiful ship.  I bet you'll have fun building that.

speaker: Martin
text: Not as much fun as we're having reading about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Did I ever mention one of my ancestors was a mutineer on the

speaker: Martin
text: No kidding.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah well, from what we could gather, he made it safely to Pitcairn Island, where he was quite fruitful and multiplied. You know, for all I know there's some girl who looks exactly like me running around the South Seas, frolicking in the surf, all brown-skinned and bare-breasted- _Niles snaps the mast in two, sending the pieces flying over the table. Martin and Daphne look at him._

speaker: Niles
text: So you want to build a _two_ -masted schooner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Schooner?  I thought it was a frigate.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, a frigate has a fore-and-aft mainsail.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, that's a brigantine.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you're right.  Well, then what's a frigate?

speaker: Martin
text: That's when you just don't give a damn anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all. [_everyone ad-libs hellos_] Niles, are you going to be spending the evening with us?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  As much as my Maris misses me, she feels family comes first.  When she saw this model, she felt it was the perfect project for me to share with Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: She wanted you out of the house, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Like a musty smell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, I have a proposal for you.  Seems there's a woman in Roz's building who would like to go out with you.  Roz says that she's got a wonderful personality.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  I guess that means I'm the pretty one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just hear me out.  She likes sports, she likes beer...

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, so does Duke.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but Duke won't kiss you good night at the end of the evening.

speaker: Martin
text: He will if he's had a few.  Look, tell Roz thanks, but no thanks.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think you're making a mistake.  Trying new things is what keeps us all young and vibrant.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, you're right, Daphne.  For weeks, all Maris did for excitement was float in her sensory deprivation tank. But now, she's taken up fencing, and I've never seen her more vital. [_Frasier's ears prick up at this._] She stays up late into the evening, working with her instructor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris has a fencing instructor?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Gunnar was the Bavarian champion three years running.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's Bavarian?

speaker: Niles
text: You're full of questions I've already given answers to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Am I?

speaker: Niles
text: He doesn't speak a word of English, so Maris gets to brush up on her German while she parries and thrusts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris is learning German, huh?  [_aside to Frasier_] Just when you thought she couldn't get any cuddlier.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, did you take the spanking aft?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I pre-glued it for you.

speaker: Niles
text: Good job.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, not to worry.  This sort of thing used to happen to my brothers all the time.  I can get that off with some nail- polish remover.  Come with me.

speaker: Niles
text: So your brothers built a lot of models?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, actually, I suspect they just sniffed a lot of glue.

speaker: Niles
text: You know that can cause brain damage.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, then, that confirms it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Dad!  I have to talk to you about Niles.  I got a call on the show today from a German woman whose husband is a fencing instructor who she suspects is having an affair with his wealthy new client.

speaker: Martin
text: And?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you find that the least bit incriminating?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I find it a coincidence.  Seattle's a big city, I'm sure there's a bunch of German fencing instructors, each one with dozens of students.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but are they wealthy students?

speaker: Martin
text: No, they're inner-city kids trying to work their way out of the ghetto with nothing but a foil and a dream.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, in the midst of that slag heap of sarcasm, I suppose there may be a kernel of truth.  I guess I could just be letting my imagination run away with me.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, just trust me, forget it.  Come on, help me put this model together.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, I remember how Niles used to love these models.  Oh God, remember that Christmas Mom got him the "Visible Man and Woman?"  He had to glue all of the internal organs in the right place.

speaker: Martin
text: All I remember is you two fighting over it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Niles was getting on my nerves, so I had to go in and steal his ovaries.

speaker: Daphne
text: Now there's a conversation I'm glad I missed the beginning of! **BAVARIANS AT THE GATE**  _Scene Three -- KACL Roz is setting up Frasier's booth.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry I'm late, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey, Frasier.  Did you get a chance to ask your dad about the date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  He's not interested.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, darn it.  I already got her hopes up.  I don't suppose you'd consider going out with her.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  I've had my quota of pity-dates.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, but this time you wouldn't be the one being pitied.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, listen, we have a great call to start the show off with.  Get this: the guy on line three just found out that his girlfriend is his long-lost sister.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, and that German woman called back about her husband's affair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gretchen!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_through intercom_] I want her first!

speaker: Roz
text: Are you kidding?  What am I supposed to say to the guy who's dating his sister?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just tell him to hang on and relax, we've all been there!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane on KACL.  Let's get right to the phones.  Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Gretchen calling back about her husband's affair. She thinks she has more evidence.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Gretchen.  I'm listening.

speaker: Gretchen
text: [_v.o.; crying_] Oh, Dr. Crane!  I took Roz's advice and gave my husband two choices for dinner, and he picked the diet plate!

speaker: Frasier
text: But that is no proof that he's having an affair!

speaker: Gretchen
text: But Gunnar has a healthy appetite!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, the proof is-is phone bills, uh, credit card receipts... Gunnar?

speaker: Gretchen
text: I also found a love letter he wrote to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how long were you going to keep that a secret, Gretchen? Come on, work with me here!  What does it say?

speaker: Gretchen
text: "_Mein kleine leberknodel_..."

speaker: Frasier
text: I-I'm sorry, I don't speak German.  [_N.B. It is unusual for a confirmed Freudian such as Frasier to not have read Freud in the original German.  In fact, later episodes take it for granted that Frasier does in fact speak German._]

speaker: Gretchen
text: It means, "my little liver dumpling."  That used to be his pet name for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe he's writing to you.

speaker: Gretchen
text: It can't be me.  He says he loves her beautiful _little_ body, as thin as his sword, and her skin as white as bratwurst, and that she's his _NichteinmenschlichFrau_.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that?

speaker: Gretchen
text: I don't know if there's a word in English.  The closest translation is, "not quite human woman."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God, it is her!

speaker: Gretchen
text: What should I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know!  I-I need time to think!  Let's go to commercial!  _He goes to commercial.  Roz plugs a cart in.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- KACL Roz cues Frasier that the commercial is over._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, we're back.  Gretchen, I have considered your problem, and I believe that what you must do is confront your husband, and insist that he end this affair.

speaker: Gretchen
text: But what if he won't?

speaker: Frasier
text: But he has to!  Look, innocent people are being hurt!  Remind him of how much he means to you, of all your years together. Are there children?

speaker: Gretchen
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn!  Still, still, it must be a clean break, he must never, ever see this woman again, not even accidentally!

speaker: Gretchen
text: We never had these problems back home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe that's where you should return, to the loving bosom of Bavaria.

speaker: Gretchen
text: How did you know we were from Bavaria?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... you see, I'm a master of dialects.  I noticed there was a glottal quality to the occlusion of your diphthongs.

speaker: Gretchen
text: But I'm originally from Austria.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, do you want to split hairs, or do you want your husband back?  Uh, Gretchen, I'm afraid it's time for another commercial.

speaker: Roz
text: Another commercial?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, another commercial! _He goes off the air.  Roz plugs in another cart and comes into his booth._

speaker: Roz
text: What is going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: What makes you think there's something going on?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, when the person giving advice sounds crazier than the person calling in, I think there's something going on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing's going on.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a minute.  You know who the liver dumpling is, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, yes!  But it's nobody you know.  Her husband's a good friend of mine.  Oh, how can I tell him, he'll be crushed.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you don't tell the person being cheated _on_ , you confront the person doing the _cheating_.  Didn't they teach you anything at Harvard?

speaker: Frasier
text: I-I can't do that!

speaker: Roz
text: It's easy, Frasier.  You just tell her you know she's been mattress-surfing with some other guy, and if she doesn't knock it off, you'll tell her husband.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's-it's not that easy, you don't know this woman!  She doesn't deal with confrontation very well.  I once questioned the political correctness of her serving veal. An hour later, we found her locked in the garage with the engine running on her golf cart!

speaker: Roz
text: Whoa, it's Maris. **IN CASE YOU'RE WONDERING, IT'S A SENSORY DEPRIVATION TANK**  _Scene Five -- Niles's Bathroom Marta (Niles's 78-year-old Guatemalan maid) leads Frasier into the bathroom in Niles's mansion.  The room is dominated by a huge rectangular steel tank with a hatch on the side._

speaker: Marta
text: _Missy Crane esta en la caja_.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Mrs. Crane is in the box."

speaker: Marta
text: _En la caja_.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris?  This is Frasier.  I am tired of waiting for you to come out of this ridiculous deprivation tank.  Now, listen. We've got to talk, we've got to talk about Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you come out of there!  Look, Maris... I know that you're having an affair.  But I care for you both, and I want to help you do what's best for your marriage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, will you stop this!  Just come out of this box!  All right, all right!  I'm going to open this door!  I'm going to count to three and I don't care if you're naked! [_reconsiders_] I'm going to count to ten!  Oh, the hell with this!  All right! _Frasier yanks the hatch open -- and gasps.  Sitting in the tank is Niles -- naked, dripping wet, and speechless with horror.  Marta comes back with fresh towels._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles... I'm so sorry.  Marta, you said Mrs. Crane was in the box!

speaker: Marta
text: [_looking_] _Si, Missy Crane_.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's MISTER Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Marta has trouble with her pronouns. _FADE TO:  Scene Six -- Frasier's Apartment It's evening.  Frasier and Martin are pacing the apartment._

speaker: Martin
text: I'm worried about him.  He's always been such a sensitive kid.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, Dad, and you know what?  Maybe it's wise for us not to let on how worried we are.  It'll only add to his anxiety.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you're right.  If we coddle him, he'll think this is the end of the world. _The doorbell rings.  Frasier and Martin exchange a look, then open the door to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cheerful_] Hello, Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: [_cheerful_] Hi, son! _Niles breaks down and holds out his arms.  Immediately, Frasier and Martin are hugging him, patting him on the back, saying "It's OK," "It's not the end of the world," "Everything's gonna be all right," and so on.  They steer him over to the couch.  Eddie jumps up into his lap and starts licking his face._

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, pour him a glass of brandy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, yes.  Oh God, you know, I'm all out of brandy. I have a marvelous sherry here, a couple of fine ports... oh, and this lovely new bottle of twelve-year-old unblended scotch.  It's a little bit peaty--

speaker: Martin
text: Just pour him a drink! [_to Niles_] What happened, son?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nothing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing?  Well, when I left, you were about to storm up to Maris's bedroom and have it out with her.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.  And with every step I thought of another question to fire at her, but when I reached her door, I froze.  I turned on my heel, walked out of the house, got in the car and just started driving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm glad you ended up here. [_hands him a glass of Scotch with a lemon wedge_]

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I ended up at the Oregon border check.  I had fruit in the car, so I had to turn back.  What am I going to do? She's my whole life.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, Maris may have temporarily succumbed to Gunnar's Teutonic charms, but in the end I'm sure she'll choose the man who's intelligent and sensitive.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier.  That's just something we used to tell ourselves in chess club.  The truth is, women don't want men like us -- men of intellect.  They want men of action -- men like Gunnar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know this has nothing to do with Gunnar and everything to do with you and Maris.  Do you remember the advice you gave me when I was having my problems with Lilith? You said that I should talk to her and find out why she did what she did.

speaker: Niles
text: It's one thing to give advice, it's another to take it.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, hey, Fras, didn't you and Lilith once write a bunch of articles together about the keys to a successful marriage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we did.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe it'd help your brother to read 'em right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Oh, well, all right.  I've only got half of them, though.  Lilith got the rest in the divorce settlement.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, listen, now that we've gotten rid of the foghorn, here's the way you're gonna handle this.  Now, you remember something like this happened between your mother and I, right?

speaker: Niles
text: Right.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  Well, the way I handled it was I took it up with the other man.  I told him if it ever happened again, he'd be the other woman!  Now there was a lot more that we had to do to keep our marriage together, but at least that let your mother know how much I cared for her.

speaker: Niles
text: What would you have me do?  Grab Gunnar by the scruff of the neck and escort him out of my house?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, why not?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I've been fantasizing about it!  It's just not me, though... although, maybe it should be me!  No, no, I've got to speak to Maris eventually... although, if I do it your way, I'm going at it from a position of strength.  I'm gonna do it, Dad!  Maris has fencing practice tonight, but it's Gunnar who's going to be taught a lesson!

speaker: Martin
text: That's my boy!  You're sure you're up to it?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I am! [_he guns down the rest of his drink_] I'm pumped, I'm psyched, and I'm fairly certain I just swallowed an entire twist of lemon! _Niles clears his throat and leaves.  Frasier comes back with a sheaf of papers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Did I just hear Niles leave?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he went to straighten out that Gunnar guy!

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, Dad, how could you let him go? [_grabs his coat_] What if this Gunnar guy doesn't want to get straightened out? What if he wants to fight?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's all right, it's still better this way!  At least he's found his manhood.

speaker: Martin
text: I tell ya, I'd be happy if Niles traded in a couple of teeth for his _cojones_!

speaker: Daphne
text: I've got to stop walking in on the middle of conversations! **GET OUT YOUR DICTIONARIES**  _Scene Seven -- Niles's Mansion In the living room of Niles's house, Gunnar -- a tall, thin-faced German -- is on the couch, getting his fencing gear ready for Maris.  Niles comes down the stairs, followed by Frasier and Marta._

speaker: Niles
text: There you are! [_Gunnar looks up_] Yes, I'm talking to you, strudel boy!  No one seduces my wife and gets away with it! You probably thought because of my refined bearing and swimmer's build that I wouldn't put up a fight for the woman I love.  But you're dead wrong, because real men have a thing called "honor!" [_Gunnar stands up; he's a full head taller than Niles_] Yow!  You wouldn't know about that, would you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You wouldn't know how decent people behave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You wouldn't know the meaning of the word "rectitude!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, he wouldn't know the meaning of the word "dog," "cat," or "pencil!"  He doesn't speak English, remember?!

speaker: Gunnar
text: [_to Marta_] _Wieso ist er so bose?_

speaker: Marta
text: _Ich weiss nicht._

speaker: Niles
text: Marta!  You speak German?

speaker: Marta
text: _Que?_

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, _habla alleman?_

speaker: Marta
text: _Si!  Yo trabajo para una familia allemana que llego a Guatemala despues a la Guerra._

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently she worked for a German family that turned up in Guatemala... [_deep voice_] just after the war.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, well, good, good!  She can translate for me!  Tell her to tell him--

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, just wait!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look at him!  God, if he knew you were calling him "strudel boy," he'd be wiping his feet on your face!

speaker: Niles
text: Hang that, Frasier!  If there're going to be scuffs, they'll be scuffs of honor. [_to Gunnar_] How dare you steal my wife! [_to Frasier_] Translate!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right. [_to Marta_] _Senor Crane quiere que preguntas a Gunnar, uh, "Como se atrevez a robar mis zapatos!"_

speaker: Marta
text: [_to Gunnar_] _Was fallt Dir ein meine Schuhe zu stehlen?_

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Schweinehund!_

speaker: Niles
text: All right, fine, you want to challenge me? [_throws off his jacket and grabs the other sword_] _En garde!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, Niles, that's just what we need, a fourth language! Niles, you can't possibly fight this man!

speaker: Niles
text: Are you forgetting?  I've been fencing since prep school!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, oh, so what?  The man was obviously born with a sword in his hand!  He probably performed his own Caesarean!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God, he's gonna kill me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pointing_] _Farvegnugen!_

speaker: Gunnar
text: [_looking_] _Farvegnugen?_ _Niles breaks away and dashes across the room, tipping over the couch as he goes.  Gunnar chases him, and they fight near the stairs. Gunnar makes a sudden slash, shattering a Ming vase._

speaker: Gunnar
text: [_apologizing_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, very nice, very nice, thank you! _Realizing what's going on, they start to fight again.  They lock their swords together, and Gunnar pushes Niles upstairs, out of sight.  A moment later, Niles runs downstairs and hides behind the stairwell pillar.  When Gunnar comes down looking for him, Niles ambushes him.  Niles fends off Gunnar's attacks and jumps up onto the piano.  Laughing with sheer adrenaline, he shakes his hips and gives Gunnar a "Take Your Best Shot!" grin.  They fight some more.  Niles slashes at Gunnar's head, but he ducks. Gunnar slashes at Niles's ankle, but he hops over it.  Niles grins and swashes his sword back and forth.  Gunnar swashes his own sword. Niles swashes his sword again, but loses his grip and drops it on the floor.  As Gunnar presses forward, Niles turns, jumps, and swings across the room on the chandelier like a pirate in a movie -- only the roof plaster cracks, and Niles falls sprawling onto the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Niles!  Niles, my God, are you all right? _Before Niles can get up, Gunnar presses the tip of his sword into the soft flesh of his neck._

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Entschuldige Dich sofort!  Ich habe nicht Deine Schuhe gestohlen!_

speaker: Niles
text: [_meekly, to Frasier_] Is he giving up?

speaker: Marta
text: _Piedme perdon!  Yo no te robo sus zapatos!_

speaker: Frasier
text: He says he wants you to apologize.  He didn't steal... your shoes.

speaker: Niles
text: My shoes?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sorry.  Apparently I mistranslated. [_to Marta_] Look, he didn't mean, uh... not shoes, wife!  _No zapatos, esposa!_

speaker: Marta
text: [_to Gunnar_] _Nicht Schuhe, Frau!_

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Frau?_

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Maris ist unwiderstehlich._

speaker: Marta
text: [_to Frasier_] _No me puede contralar.  Maris est irresistible._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] He couldn't help himself, Maris is irresistible. [_to Marta, in Spanish_] _Irresistible?_

speaker: Marta
text: [_to Gunnar_] _Unwiderstehlich?_

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Ja._

speaker: Marta
text: _Si._

speaker: Frasier
text: O-kayy.

speaker: Gunnar
text: _Aber sie hat mich abgewiesen._

speaker: Marta
text: _Pero me rechazo._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, but she refused him.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: _Verdad?_

speaker: Marta
text: _Wirklich?_ _Gunnar throws up his hand.  Marta throws up her hand to Frasier, who throws up his hand to Niles, who also throws up his hand._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what did Maris say?

speaker: Frasier
text: _Que decia?_

speaker: Marta
text: _Was hat sie gesagt?_

speaker: Gunnar
text: _"Ich liebe Niles."_

speaker: Marta
text: _"Yo amo Niles."_

speaker: Frasier
text: "I love Niles."

speaker: Niles
text: She loves me! [_hugs Frasier_] Oh, she loves me!  [_hugs Marta_] My marriage is whole!

speaker: Niles
text: Give me five seconds, then tell him he's fired. [_running upstairs_] Maris!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh lord, if only I can do something to help Gunnar and Gretchen.

speaker: Gunnar
text: [_looking up_] Gretchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: _Ja, ja,_ uh... [_to Marta_] Tell him that his wife loves him very much.  Uh, I mean, _diga a Gunnar que su esposa le ama mucho._

speaker: Marta
text: _Diem Frau_ [_points at Frasier_] _liebt ihn sehr._

speaker: Gunnar
text: _SCHWEINEHUND!_

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, not me!  You, you!  Marta, damn your pronoun problems! _He scrambles to the other side of the room.  Then, getting into the spirit, he takes a sword down from the mantle and roars a challenge at Gunnar._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then, you hapless wretch!  _They start to fence.  END OF ACT TWO_
